title: Climate change could be the spark that sets global productivity on fire
text:
Donald Trump has said many silly things in his time, but among the silliest was his insistence that “trade wars are good and easy to win”. This has proved far from the case. Geopolitical tensions in trade are in danger of tipping the entire world economy into recession.

Few doubt the legitimacy of Trump’s complaint; China has played fast and loose with the rules and needs to be brought back in line. Yet you don’t fix a problem such as unfair trade by shutting up shop and building barriers. So far, these have been just as costly to the US as they have been to China. There has also been plenty of collateral damage in Europe.
